intro: Amblyanthera lasiocarpa, commonly known as the rough-leaved amblyanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic study.
